trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: While the phalanx has more than half its maximum hit points, it has advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The phalanx can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the phalanx can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature.

trait.name: Form Up
entries: If the phalanx is missing hit points, a friendly humanoid with the phalanx or soldier tag that is within 5 feet can use an action to merge into the phalanx, destroying itself and restoring hit point to the phalanx. If the merging creature is a phalanx, the phalanx regains hit points equal to the destroyed phalanx's current hit points. If the merging creature is a soldier, the phalanx regains hit points equal to four times the creature's CR.

trait.name: Variable Size
entries: The phalanx is immune to spells and magic effects that alter its size. While the phalanx has half its hit points or fewer, it becomes Large. If it restores enough hit points to have more than half its maximum hit points, it becomes Huge again.

trait.name: Lines and Squares
entries: The phalanx can either occupy a 15-foot square (or 10-foot while Large) or a 20-foot line that is 10-feet wide (or a 10-feet line while Large). It can expend half its movement on a turn to change which formation it is in.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Phalanx makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage or {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Slings
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) piercing damage or {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

reaction.name: Pike Wall
entries: When a creature moves into the reach of the phalax's Pike attack, the phalanx can use a reaction to make a Pike attack against that creature. If the creature is Large or larger, the phalanx has advantage on this attack.

variant.name: Variants
entries: At the DM's discretion, some phalanxes may have one or more additional traits providing some varity. This trait might represent aleigence to a particular faction, the racial makeup of its members or even just a little extra flavor. Some examples are included below.

items: {@b Arcane Warriors}. The phalanx knows a cantrip that has a casting time of 1 action. When the phalanx uses its Multiattack, it can replace one attack with the cantrip. Wisdom is the phalanx's spellcasting ability for this cantrip.

{@b Breath Weapon}. When the phanlanx uses its Multiattack, it can replace one of the attacks with a breath weapon attack in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Wisdom modifier) or take {@dice PBd10} damage of one of the following types; acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.
{@b Darkvison}. The phalanx has darkvision out to 60 feet.
{@b Enhanced Movement}. The phalanx has a climbing or swimming speed equal to its walking speed.
{@b Raiders}. The the phalanx has advantage on ability checks and attack rolls made to break through doors, damage wooden objects or to grapple humanoid creatures.
{@b Resistance}. The phalanx has resistance to a damage type of the DM's choice.
{@b Small Swarm}. The phalanx is a swarm of Small humanoids and can move through and opening wide enough for a Small creature.
{@b Speedy}.The phalanx has a walking speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The phalanx can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the phalanx can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature.

If the merging creature is a soldier, the phalanx regains hit points equal to four times the creature's CR.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Phalanx makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}63 ({@damage 10d10 + 8}) piercing damage or {@h}35 ({@damage 5d10 + 8}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Slings
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 10d4 + 4}) piercing damage or {@h}17 ({@damage 5d4 + 4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: While the ship crew has more than half its maximum hit points, it has advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The ship crew can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the phalanx can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature.

trait.name: Crew the Ship
entries: When the Ship Crew uses its action to act as the crew of a ship, it counts as a number of crew equal to 20% of its current hit points (rounded down, minimum of 1).

action.name: Blades Out
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) bludgeoning or slashing damage or {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning or slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage or {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Grappling Hooks
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one Large or larger object. {@h}The object cannot be moved away from the ship crew until they release it (no action required), they use this action again, they are {@condition incapacitated} or another creature within 5 feet uses an action to remove the hooks. If the object is a vehicle and takes a move action to move away from the ship crew, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or the move action fails.

action.name: Heave
entries: The ship crew attempts to pull an object it has hooked with its Grappling Hooks towards itself. It makes a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, the object is pulled 15 feet towards the ship crew.

variant.name: Variant: Crew Actions vs Ship Actions
entries: The current version of this statblock assumes a ruleset in which the ship itself has actions and the crew simply contribute to those actions by numbers alone. If you are not using such a ruleset or the ship does not use its own actions, such as spelljammers, you may wish with to replace the Crew the Ship trait with the folllowing:

entries.name: Crew Actions
entries: While on board a ship they control, the ship crew takes one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The ship moves up to 20 feet, or 10 feet if the ship crew has half of its hit points or fewer.

items.name: Fire
entries: The ship crew loads, aims and fires a weapon mounted on the vehicle. The attack deals an additional {@dice 1d10} damage if the ship crew has more than half its hit points.

items.name: Repair
entries: The ship crew touches a component or weapon of the vehicle and restores 10 hit points it, or 5 hit points if the ship crew has half of its hit points or fewer.

items.name: Brace
entries: The crew protects a itself, a creature, or a component or weapon on the ship within 5 feet. Attacks against the target have disadvantage.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: While the ship crew has more than half its maximum hit points, it has advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The ship crew can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the phalanx can move through an opening wide enough for a Medium creature.

trait.name: Crew the Ship
entries: When the Ship Crew uses its action to act as the crew of a ship, it counts as a number of crew equal to 20% of its current hit points (rounded down, minimum of 1).

action.name: Blades Out
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 6d6 + 3}) bludgeoning or slashing damage or {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning or slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage or {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Grappling Hooks
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one Large or larger object. {@h}The object cannot be moved away from the ship crew until they release it (no action required), they use this action again, they are {@condition incapacitated} or another creature within 5 feet uses an action to remove the hooks. If the object is a vehicle and takes a move action to move away from the ship crew, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or the move action fails.

action.name: Heave
entries: The ship crew attempts to pull an object it has hooked with its Grappling Hooks towards itself. It makes a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, the object is pulled 15 feet towards the ship crew.

variant.name: Variant: Crew Actions vs Ship Actions
entries: The current version of this statblock assumes a ruleset in which the ship itself has actions and the crew simply contribute to those actions by numbers alone. If you are not using such a ruleset or the ship does not use its own actions, such as spelljammers, you may wish with to replace the Crew the Ship trait with the folllowing:

entries.name: Crew Actions
entries: While on board a ship they control, the ship crew takes one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The ship moves up to 30 feet, or 15 feet if the ship crew has half of its hit points or fewer.

items.name: Fire
entries: The ship crew loads, aims and fires a weapon mounted on the vehicle. The attack deals an additional {@dice 2d10} damage if the ship crew has more than half its hit points.

items.name: Repair
entries: The ship crew touches a component or weapon of the vehicle and restores 20 hit points it, or 10 hit points if the ship crew has half of its hit points or fewer.

items.name: Brace
entries: The crew protects a itself, a creature, or a component or weapon on the ship within 5 feet. Attacks against the target have disadvantage.

trait.name: Strength in Numbers

entries.name: Crew Actions
entries: While on board a ship they control, the ship crew takes one of the following actions:

items.name: Move

items.name: Fire
